markdownRemark.html:
After one month in quarrantine, situations are now being relaxed. During that one month, we have been doing a lot of technical 101 talks. 10, to be exact. Our deepest thanks go to our speakers:

  • Trung Ly (@exNewbie) for his talk on AWS LightSail, a cheap way to get started on AWS.
  • Cuong Do (@dohaicuong) for his talk on GraphQL 101, and how to replace REST APIs with GraphQL to reduce “endpoint spaghetti”.
  • Andy Truong (@andytruong) for his ideas about implementing microservices architecture and all of its troubles.
  • Sam Huynh (@samhwang) for an introduction on Docker and Docker-Compose, and also on getting started with CI/CD with GitHub Actions.
  • Paul Nguyen (@punkupoz) for an introduction to container orchestration with Kubernetes.
  • Luan Nguyen (@tklarryonline) for an in-depth overview of UX/UI Design in Agile projects.
  • Van Hoang LinkedIn, who brought us inside the minds of a recruiter in the tech world.
  • Toan Ha LinkedIn, with his brief description on what Business Analysis actually is, and what should be involved.
  • Last and not least, we have Khiem Nguyen LinkedIn shed light to us on his journey transitioning from a Developer to a Businessman.

We hope that everyone had been learning something new. Not just from the talks, but also on your own as well. Keep on learning, and keep on keeping on.

frontmatter.title: One month in Quarrantine
frontmatter.description: What we have been doing in quarrantine
